news.title: Maharashtra government grants legal status to digital land records
news.para: Maharashtra has officially granted legal status to digitally signed land records, including 7/12 and 8-A extracts. This landmark move eliminates the need for manual stamps and signatures, allowing citizens to obtain certified copies online for a nominal fee. The reform promises to end red tape, reduce corruption, and expedite land-related transactions for farmers and landowners across the state.

news.title: Delhi civic body proposes no hike in property tax rates for FY27
news.para: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi presented a Rs 16,531-crore budget for 2026-27, maintaining no property tax increases for the third consecutive year. The budget highlights a significant rise in taxpayer base and tax collection, with plans for administrative reforms and revenue enhancement through various initiatives.

news.title: Himachal Pradesh assembly refers land reforms bill to select committee
news.para: The Himachal Pradesh Assembly has referred the Tenancy and Land Reforms (Amendment) Bill, 2025 to a Select Committee for further examination. This committee is tasked with analyzing the bill and will deliver its recommendations at the upcoming Budget Session.

news.title: Nexus Select Trust evaluating three mall acquisitions in eastern India
news.para: Nexus Select Trust is exploring the acquisition of three malls in eastern India. The REIT is dedicating upwards of Rs 10 crore to transform South City Mall, with an emphasis on modernizing infrastructure and leveraging the latest technology.

news.title: Hyderabad: HMDA rakes in ₹3,862 crore as Neopolis-Golden Mile auctions hit new highs
news.para: Hyderabad's land market continues its strong performance, with HMDA auctions in Neopolis and Golden Mile layouts fetching ₹3,862 crore. The latest phase saw a 1.98-acre plot in Golden Mile sold for ₹77.75 crore per acre, reinforcing investor confidence in the city's growth. This sustained demand highlights Hyderabad's appeal as a prime real estate investment hub.

news.title: Frontier Warehousing acquires controlling stake in Kesoram Industries, Birla family exits
news.para: Kesoram Industries is undergoing a significant shift in leadership as Frontier Warehousing Limited steps in to acquire a controlling interest. This pivotal move signals the end of the Birla family's long-standing involvement with the company.

news.title: Sanjali Bajaj buys sea-view apartment in Mumbai’s Worli for ₹66 crore
news.para: Sanjali Bajaj, daughter of Bajaj Group’s Sanjiv Bajaj, has bought a ₹66.41-crore sea-view luxury apartment in Mumbai’s Worli. The 5,510 sq ft home includes a 430 sq ft balcony and additional podium-level spaces for parking. She paid ₹3.32 crore in stamp duty for the November 14 deal.

news.title: Average US long-term mortgage rate falls to 6.19%, near its low for the year
news.para: Home loan borrowing costs in USA are falling again. The average rate for a 30-year mortgage is now close to its lowest point this year. This trend is expected to continue. Lower rates boost buyer power. Experts predict rates will stay above 6% next year. This offers hope for aspiring homeowners.

news.title: House prices in UK stagnate in November 2025: Halifax
news.para: In November, the UK housing market hit a pause, with house prices holding steady compared to the previous month. Annual growth has waned, hitting its lowest figure since March 2024, as buyers tread carefully in anticipation of the government's upcoming budget reveal. Notably, affordability has improved significantly, reaching levels not seen since 2015.

news.title: China Vanke seeks second onshore bond extension, skips call on separate 2028 note
news.para: In a bid to stabilize its financial situation, China Vanke is reaching out to bondholders, seeking to push back the repayment deadlines for its maturing bonds. Additionally, the company is requesting a one-year extension on an onshore bond, introducing proposals that involve credit support from Shenzhen Metro, which is the largest shareholder in Vanke.

news.title: Wakefit mobilises ₹580 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
news.para: Wakefit Innovations Ltd has attracted Rs 580 crore from anchor investors in anticipation of its upcoming Initial Public Offering (IPO) of Rs 1,289 crore, which commences on December 8. The funds will be strategically allocated for expanding its retail presence, acquiring new equipment, and ramping up marketing initiatives.

news.title: High number of real-estate dispute cases in Delhi, Mumbai; builders' reputation being hit: SC
news.para: In a bid to address growing anxieties, the Supreme Court is taking a closer look at the numerous real estate disputes cropping up in Delhi-NCR and Mumbai. These cases, involving countless homebuyers caught in redevelopment nightmares, are startlingly prevalent in these regions but scarce elsewhere.

news.title: Mormugao civic body seals two bank premises for rent default
news.para: The Mormugao Municipal Council (MMC) sealed branches of a public sector and a private bank for outstanding rent dues totaling Rs 9 lakh.  The council also adopted a unique 'Gandhian' approach, offering roses to defaulters in an appeal for payment, aiming to recover funds for employee salaries.

news.title: Smartworld Developers acquires six acres land in Noida for ₹414 crore
news.para: Smartworld Developers has acquired a six-acre land parcel in Noida for ₹414 crore. The company plans a ₹2,000 crore development for branded residences, retail, and serviced homes.

news.title: MPCB shuts 19 polluting RMC plants across Mumbai region
news.para: Maharashtra Pollution Control Board has shut down 19 ready-mix concrete plants across the Mumbai Metropolitan Region for violating environmental norms. Inspections revealed inadequate dust control and emission measures. The board also took action against illegal metal-processing furnaces and directed preventive steps for garbage burning.

news.title: Nexus Select Trust buys 60,000 sq ft retail space in Elante Chandigarh for ₹253.7 crore
news.para: Nexus Select Trust has bought 60,000 sq ft of retail space in Nexus Elante, Chandigarh. The acquisition cost ₹253.7 crore. This expansion will meet strong tenant demand. The new space is expected to boost income. This move aims to improve the mall's overall performance.

news.title: Ahmedabad: 11 tenements sealed for running illegal PG units in Thaltej area
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) has sealed eleven paying guest (PG) tenements in Thaltej for operating without necessary permissions. This action follows a city-wide operation identifying 401 PG units, with 385 issued notices for lacking police and society NOCs. The AMC plans further sealing actions against unauthorized PG units in societies.

news.title: OSHB, BDA allot 1,600-plus plots in Bhubaneswar
news.para: Over the past three decades, the Odisha State Housing Board and Bhubaneswar Development Authority have collectively allocated more than 1,600 plots and houses in Bhubaneswar. These allotments were made under various housing schemes, including Satyasai Enclave, Dharma Vihar, Pokhariput, Ananta Housing Scheme, and Lingaraj Vihar. Both authorities are also undertaking new projects to further address housing needs in the city.

news.title: RBI cuts repo rate to 5.25%, boost for real estate and economic growth
news.para: The Reserve Bank of India has reduced its key repo rate to 5.25 percent. This decision comes as inflation remains at historical lows and showcases India's resilient economic growth. With this lowered rate, the real estate market is poised for a surge in demand and enhanced affordability for potential homebuyers.
